suspended_utility Module Reference
test_transport

Routines provide the general calculation for suspended sediment sinks/sources routines. All the constant based drived variables are here !: More...

List of all members.

Public Member Functions

subroutine settling_velocity (settling_v, kinematic_viscosity, specific_gravity, diameter, g_acceleration, nclass, function_van_rijn)
 Calculates particle's settling velocity. NOTE: the subroutine works with SI units. Settling velocity formula based on Leo van Rijn (1984b). The subroutine does not consider particles smaller than 10 microns (fine clay). The smaller particles are assumed to be either part of wash load or pertain to cohesive sediment. The subroutine is for non-cohesive particles.
pure subroutine submerged_specific_gravity (capital_r, water_density, sediment_density)
 Calculates the submerged specific gravity.
pure subroutine explicit_particle_reynolds_number (exp_re_p, diameter, capital_r, g_acceleration, kinematic_viscosity, nclass)
 Calculates the explicit particle Reynolds number.
pure subroutine particle_reynolds_number (re_p, settling_v, diameter, kinematic_viscosity, nclass)
 Calculates particle Reynolds number.
pure subroutine dimless_particle_diameter (d_star, g_acceleration, diameter, kinematic_viscosity, capital_r, nclass)
 Calculates dimensionless particle diameter.
pure subroutine critical_shields_parameter (cr_shields_prmtr, d_star, nclass)
 Calculates critical shields parameter based on Yalin (1972) formula See van Rijn book equation (4.1.11)
subroutine shear_velocity_calculator (shear_velocity, velocity, manning, gravity, hydr_radius, ncell, si_flag)
subroutine rouse_dimensionless_number (rouse_num, fall_vel, shear_vel, ncell, nclass, von_karman)
 Calculate Rouse number from given shear velocity Ro # < 0.8 wash load and does not consider in sed transport Ro # (0.8~1.2) 100% suspended load Ro # (1.2~2.5) 50% suspended load Ro # (2.5~ 7 ) bedload Ro # > 7 does not move at all.
subroutine allocation_ratio (susp_percent, bed_percent, rouse_num, nclass, ncell)
 subroutine to calculate the percentage in suspension

Detailed Description

Routines provide the general calculation for suspended sediment sinks/sources routines. All the constant based drived variables are here !:

Member Function/Subroutine Documentation

subroutine suspended_utility::rouse_dimensionless_number ( real(stm_real), dimension(ncell,nclass), intent(out)  rouse_num,
real(stm_real), dimension(nclass), intent(in)  fall_vel,
real(stm_real), dimension(ncell), intent(in)  shear_vel,
integer, intent(in)  ncell,
integer, intent(in)  nclass,
real(stm_real), intent(in), optional  von_karman 
)

Calculate Rouse number from given shear velocity Ro # < 0.8 wash load and does not consider in sed transport Ro # (0.8~1.2) 100% suspended load Ro # (1.2~2.5) 50% suspended load Ro # (2.5~ 7 ) bedload Ro # > 7 does not move at all.

Parameters:
[in]nclassNumber of sediment classes
[in]ncellNumber of cells
[out]rouse_numRouse dimensionless number
[in]fall_velSettling velocity
[in]shear_velShear velocity
[in]von_karmanVon karman constant, Kappa = 0.41
subroutine suspended_utility::settling_velocity ( real(stm_real), dimension(nclass), intent(out)  settling_v,
real(stm_real), intent(in)  kinematic_viscosity,
real(stm_real), intent(in)  specific_gravity,
real(stm_real), dimension(nclass), intent(in)  diameter,
real(stm_real), intent(in)  g_acceleration,
integer, intent(in)  nclass,
logical, optional  function_van_rijn 
)

Calculates particle's settling velocity. NOTE: the subroutine works with SI units. Settling velocity formula based on Leo van Rijn (1984b). The subroutine does not consider particles smaller than 10 microns (fine clay). The smaller particles are assumed to be either part of wash load or pertain to cohesive sediment. The subroutine is for non-cohesive particles.

Parameters:
[in]nclassNumber of sediment diameter classes
[out]settling_vSettling velocity (m/s)
[in]kinematic_viscosityKinematic viscosity (m2/sec)
[in]specific_gravitySpecific gravity of particle (~2.65)
[in]diameterParticle diameter in meter
[in]g_accelerationGravitational acceleration (m/sec2)
function_van_rijnFlag for using van Rijn (1984) formula o/ Dietrich (1982). the default is van Rijn
subroutine suspended_utility::shear_velocity_calculator ( real(stm_real), dimension(ncell), intent(out)  shear_velocity,
real(stm_real), dimension(ncell), intent(in)  velocity,
real(stm_real), dimension(ncell), intent(in)  manning,
real(stm_real), intent(in)  gravity,
real(stm_real), dimension(ncell), intent(in)  hydr_radius,
integer, intent(in)  ncell,
logical, optional  si_flag 
)
Parameters:
[in]ncellNumber of cells
[in]velocityFlow velocity
[in]manningManning's n
[in]hydr_radiusHydraulic radius
[in]gravityGravity
[out]shear_velocityShear velocity
si_flagSI and British unit switch
pure subroutine suspended_utility::submerged_specific_gravity ( real(stm_real), intent(out)  capital_r,
real(stm_real), intent(in)  water_density,
real(stm_real), intent(in)  sediment_density 
)

Calculates the submerged specific gravity.

Parameters:
[out]capital_rSubmerged specific gravity of sediment particles
[in]water_densityWater density
[in]sediment_densitySolid particle density
